16.q: Where did Jesus come from and where was he going?

16.a: Jesus said the disciples would be scattered, everyone to his own possessions, and they would leave Jesus alone.
16.q: What did Jesus say the disciples would do at that hour?

16.a: The Father was still going to be with Jesus.
16.q: Who was still going to be with Jesus after the disciples left him alone?

16.a: Jesus told them to be encouraged because he had overcome the world.
16.q: Why did Jesus tell the disciples to be encouraged even though in the world they would have troubles?

17.a: The Father did this so that he should give everlasting life to all whom you have given him.
17.q: Why did the Father give Jesus authority over all flesh?

17.a: Everlasting life is knowing the Father, the only true God, and him whom you have sent, Jesus Christ.
He did this by accomplishing the work that the Father gave him to do.
17.q: How did Jesus glorifiy God on the earth?

17.a: He wants the glory he had with the Father before the world was created.
Jesus revealed the Father's name to the people the Father gave to Jesus out of the world.
17.q: To whom did Jesus reveal the Father's name?

17.a: They received Jesus' words and truly knew that Jesus came from the Father and they believed that the Father sent Jesus.
17.q: How did those people the Father gave to Jesus respond to Jesus' words?

17.a: Jesus asks the Father to keep them in the Father's name so they may be one, to keep them from the evil one, to consecrate them in the truth, for them to be in both Jesus and the Father and to have those the Father has given him to be with him where he is.
17.q: In brief what does Jesus ask the Father to do for those the Father has given to Jesus?

17.a: Jesus says he is not praying for the world.
17.q: Who does Jesus say he is not praying for?
While Jesus was in the world, what did Jesus do for those the Father had given to him?

17.a: Jesus consecrated himself so that those the Father gave him might also be consecrated in truth.
Jesus prays for those who will believe in him through the word of those who followed him at that time.
17.q: For whom else does Jesus pray?

17.a: The Father loves them even as he loved Jesus.
17.q: How does the Father love those he gave to Jesus?

17.a: Jesus did and will make it known so that the love with which the Father loved Jesus may be in them and that Jesus may be in them.
17.q: Why did and will Jesus make the Father's name known to those the Father has given to him?

18.a: He went with his disciples over the Kidron Valley to a garden and he entered it.
18.q: After Jesus spoke these words, where did he go?

18.a: He knew about it because Jesus often went there with his disciples.
18.q: How did Judas know about the garden?

18.a: Judas, a group of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees also came to the garden.
18.q: Who else came to the garden with lanterns, torches and weapons?

18.a: Jesus asked them, "For whom are you looking?"
18.q: What did Jesus ask this group of people in the garden?

18.a: The soldiers and others with them went backward and fell to the ground.
18.q: What happened when the group of people said they were looking for Jesus of Nazareth and Jesus responded, "I am."?

18.a: Jesus said this so that the word might be fulfilled that he said: "Of those whom you have given me, I lost not one."
18.q: Why did Jesus say, "I told you that I am he; so if you are looking for me, let these others go."?

18.a: Jesus said to Peter, "Put your sword back into its sheath. The cup that the Father has given me, should I not drink it?"
18.q: What did Jesus tell Peter after Peter cut off the ear of Malchus, the servant of the high priest?

18.a: They first took Jesus to Annas.
18.q: After the group of soldiers, their captain and the officers of the Jews seized Jesus, where did they take him?

18.a: Annas was the father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
18.q: Who was Annas?

18.a: Another disciple who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the woman servant who was guarding the door and brought in Peter.
18.q: How did Peter get into the courtyard of the high priest?

18.a: The woman guarding the door to the courtyard, the people standing around the fire of coals and one of the servants of the high priest, who was a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, all asked Peter if he was with Jesus or a disciple of Jesus.
18.q: Who asked Peter if he was a disciple of Jesus or was with Jesus?

18.a: Jesus said he spoke openly to the world in public. He told the chief priest to ask those who heard him about what he said.
18.q: In brief how did Jesus answer when the high priest asked Jesus about his disciples and his teaching?

18.a: Annas sent Jesus to Caiaphas the high priest.
18.q: After Annas questioned Jesus where did he send Jesus?

18.a: The rooster crowed immediately after the third time Peter denied being associated with Christ.
18.q: What happened immediately after Peter denied being associated with Christ for the third time?

18.a: They did not enter the Praetorium so that they might not be defiled and so that they might eat the passover.
18.q: Why did those who took Jesus to the Praetorium not enter it?

18.a: They answered and said to him, "If this man were not an evil doer, we would not have delivered him up to you."
18.q: How did Jesus' accusers answer Pilot when he asked them, "What accusation are you bringing against this man?"

18.a: The Jews wanted to kill Jesus and it wasn't lawful for them to put any man to death without permission from the Roman authorities (Pilate).
18.q: Why did the Jews take Jesus to Pilate instead of punishing Jesus themselves?

18.a: Pilate asked Jesus if he was the king of the Jews, and he also asked Jesus what he had done.
18.q: What did Pilate ask Jesus?

18.a: Jesus told Pilate that his kingdom is not part of this world and does not come from here.
18.q: What did Jesus tell Pilate about Jesus' kingdom?

18.a: Jesus was born to be a king.
18.q: For what purpose was Jesus born?

18.a: Pilate said to the Jews, "I find no crime in this man."
18.q: What is Pilate's judgment about Jesus after talking with him?

18.a: The Jews cried out again and said, "Not this man, but Barabbas."
18.q: When Pilate offered to release Jesus, what did the Jews cry out to Pilate?

19.a: The soldiers twisted thorns together to make a crown, put it on Jesus' head, and dressed him in a purple garment. They came to him and said, "Hail, king of the Jews!" and they struck him with their hands.
19.q: What did the soldiers do to Jesus after Pilate had Jesus whipped?

19.a: Pilate brought Jesus out to the people so that they would know that Pilate found no guilt in Jesus.
19.q: Why did Pilate bring Jesus out to the people again?

19.a: Jesus was wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment.
19.q: What was Jesus wearing when Pilate brought him back out to the people?

19.a: They cried out and said, "Crucify him, crucify him!"
19.q: What did the chief priests and the officers say when they saw Jesus?

19.a: The Jews told Pilate, "We have a law, and by that law he ought to die because he made himself the Son of God."
19.q: What did the Jews say that made Pilate even more afraid?

19.a: Jesus gave Pilate no answer.
19.q: What did Jesus say when Pilate asked Jesus, "From where do you come?"

19.a: Jesus said, "You would have no power against me unless it had been given you from above."
19.q: Who did Jesus say gave Pilate power over Jesus?

19.a: The Jews cried out saying, "If you release this man, you are not Caesar's friend: Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar."
19.q: Although Pilate wanted to release Jesus, what did the Jews say that prevented him?

19.a: The chief priests said, "We have no king but Caesar."
19.q: What was the last thing the chief priests said before Pilate handed Jesus over to them to be crucified?

19.a: They crucified Jesus at Golgotha which means the place of a skull.
19.q: Where did they crucify Jesus?

19.a: No. Two other men, one on each side of Jesus were crucified with him.
19.q: Was Jesus the only one crucified there that day?

19.a: On the sign was written, "JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS."
19.q: What did Pilate write on the sign that was put on the cross of Jesus?

19.a: The sign was written in Hebrew, Latin and Greek.
19.q: In what languages was the sign on Jesus' cross written?

19.a: The soldiers divided up Jesus' garments into four parts, a part for each soldier. But the cast lots to see who would get Jesus' shirt which was without seams.
19.q: What did the soldiers do with Jesus' garments?

19.a: This happened so that the Scripture might be fulfilled that said, "They divided my garments among themselves, and for my clothing they threw lots."
19.q: Why did the soldiers do what they did with Jesus' garments?

19.a: Jesus' mother, his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, Mary Magdalene, and the disciple whom Jesus loved were standing near the cross of Jesus.
19.q: Who was standing near the cross of Jesus?

19.a: Jesus told her, "Woman, see, here is your son!"
19.q: What did Jesus tell his mother when he saw his mother and the disciple he loved standing nearby?

19.a: From that hour the disciple Jesus loved took Jesus' mother to his own home.
19.q: What did the disciple Jesus loved do after Jesus told him, "See, here is your mother!"?

19.a: Jesus said this in order to make the Scriptures come true.
19.q: Why did Jesus say, "I am thirsty."

19.a: After taking the vinegar Jesus said, "It is finished." Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.
19.q: What did Jesus do after he had taken the vinegar from the sponge that was held up to his mouth?

19.a: It was the Preparation, and in order that the bodies should not remain on the cross during the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was an important day), the Jews asked Pilate that the legs of the executed men be broken and that their bodies might be taken down.
19.q: Why did the Jews want Pilate to break the legs of the executed men?

19.a: They didn't break Jesus' legs because they saw he was already dead.
19.q: Why did the soldiers not break Jesus' legs?

19.a: One of the soldiers pierced Jesus' side with a spear.
19.q: What did the soldiers do to Jesus after they was that he was already dead?

19.a: These things came about so that the scripture might be fulfilled, "Not a single bone of him will be broken." and again, "They will look on him whom they pierced."
19.q: Why were the legs of Jesus not broken and why was Jesus pierced with a spear?

19.a: That one bore withness to these events so that you also may believe
19.q: Why did the one who saw all these things concerning the crucifiction of Jesus bear witness to them?

19.a: Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus.
19.q: Who came and asked to take away the body of Jesus?

19.a: Nicodemus came with Joseph of Arimathea.
19.q: Who came with Joseph of Arimathea to take away the body of Jesus?

19.a: They wrapped Jesus body in linen cloths with spices. Then they laid Jesus' body in a new tomb which was in a garden.
19.q: What did Joseph of Arimathea and Nicodemus do with the body of Jesus?

20.a: She came to the tomb early on the first day of the week.
20.q: When did Mary Magdalene come to the tomb?

20.a: She saw the stone rolled away from the tomb.
20.q: What did Mary Magdalene see when she got to the tomb?

20.a: She ran and came to Simon Peter and to the other disciple Jesus loved.
20.q: What did Mary Magdalene do after she saw the stone rolled away from the tomb?

20.a: She told them, "They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid him."
20.q: What did Mary Magdalene say to the two disciples?

20.a: They both ran together to the tomb.
20.q: What did Simon Peter and the other disciple do after they heard what Mary Magdalene said?

20.a: Peter saw the linen cloths lying there. The cloth that had been on his head was not lying with the linen cloths but was rolled up in its place by itself.
20.q: What did Simon Peter see in the tomb?

20.a: He saw and believed.
20.q: What was the response of the other disciple to what he saw in the tomb?

20.a: She saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the foot, where the body of Jesus had lain.
20.q: What did Mary see when she stooped and looked into the tomb?

20.a: They asked her, "Woman, why are you weeping?"
20.q: What did the angels say to Mary?

20.a: She saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that it was Jesus.
20.q: When Mary turned around what did she see?

20.a: She thought he was the gardener.
20.q: Who did Mary think Jesus was?

20.a: She recognized Jesus when he said her name, "Mary".
20.q: When did Mary recognize Jesus?

20.a: Jesus told her not to touch him because he hadn't yet ascended to the Father.
20.q: Why did Jesus tell Mary not to touch him?

20.a: Jesus told her to say to his brothers, that I will ascend to my Father and your Father, and my God and your God.
20.q: What did Jesus tell Mary to say to his brothers?

20.a: Jesus came and stood in the midst of them.
20.q: What happened where the disciples were on the evening of the first day of the week?

20.a: He showed them his hands and his side.
20.q: What did Jesus show the disciples?

20.a: Jesus said he was sending the disciples just as his Father had sent him.
20.q: What did Jesus say he was doing to the disciples?

20.a: He told them, "Receive the Holy Spirit. Whoever's sins you forgive, they are forgiven for them; whoever's sins you keep back, they are kept back."
20.q: What did Jesus say to his disciples after he breathed on them?

20.a: Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with the other disciples when Jesus came.
20.q: Which one of the disciples was not present with the other disciples when they saw Jesus?

20.a: Thomas said he would have to see the print of the nails in Jesus' hands and put his fingers into the nail prints and put his hand into Jesus' side before he would believe.
20.q: What did Thomas say it would take for him to believe that Jesus was alive?

20.a: Eight days later Thomas was with the other disciples when Jesus came while the doors were shut and stood among them.
20.q: When did Thomas see Jesus?

20.a: Jesus told Thomas to reach with his finger and see Jesus' hands and reach with his hand and put it into Jesus' side. Jesus then told Thomas not to be faithless, but believe.
20.q: What did Jesus tell Thomas to do?

20.a: Thomas said, "My Lord and my God."
20.q: What did Thomas say to Jesus?

20.a: Jesus said, "Blessed are those who have not seen, and yet have believed."
20.q: Who did Jesus say was blessed?

20.a: Yes, Jesus did many other signs in the presence of the disciples that were not written in the book of John.
20.q: Did Jesus do other signs that weren't written in the book?

20.a: They were written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and so that as you believe, you may have life in his name.
20.q: Why were the signs written in the book?

21.a: The disciples were at the Sea of Tiberias when Jesus showed himself to them again.
21.q: Where were the disciples when Jesus showed himself to them again?

21.a: Simon Peter, Thomas, called Didymus, Nathaniel from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee and two of Jesus' other disciples were at the Sea of Tiberias.
21.q: Which disciples were at the Sea of Tiberias?

21.a: These disciples had gone fishing but had caught nothing all night.
Jesus told the disciples to cast their net on the right side of the boat and they would catch some fish.
21.q: What did Jesus tell the disciples to do?

21.a: They could not draw in their net because there were so many fish in it.
21.q: What happened when the disciples cast their net?

21.a: He tucked up his outer garment about himself and threw himself into the sea.
21.q: What did Simon Peter do when the disciple Jesus loved said, "It is the Lord."

21.a: The other disciples came in the boat pulling the net full of fish.
21.q: What did the other disciples do?

21.a: Jesus told the disciples to bring some of the fish they had just caught.
21.q: What did Jesus tell the disciples to do with some of the fish that they had caught?

21.a: This was the third time Jesus had now shown himself to the disciples since he had risen.
21.q: How many times had Jesus now shown himself to the disciples since he had risen?

21.a: Jesus asked Simon Peter if Simon loved Jesus more than these.
21.q: After breakfast what was the first thing Jesus asked Simon Peter?

21.a: The third time he was asked Peter responded, "Lord, you know all things, you know that I love you."
21.q: How did Simon Peter answer Jesus the third time Jesus asked Peter if he loved Jesus?

21.a: The third time Jesus told him, "Feed my sheep."
21.q: The third time Peter responds to Jesus' question, "Do you love me?" what does Jesus tell Peter to do?

21.a: Jesus told Simon Peter that when he became old, he would stretch out his hands and another person would clothe him and carry him where he did not wish to go.
21.q: What did Jesus tell Simon Peter was going to happen to him when Simon became old?

21.a: Jesus said this in order to signal by what kind of death Peter would glorify God.
21.q: Why did Jesus tell Peter what was going to happen to Peter when he became old?

21.a: Peter asked Jesus, "Lord, what will this man do?"
21.q: What did Simon Peter ask Jesus concerning the disciple that Jesus loved?
How did Jesus respond to Peter's question, "Lord, what will this man do?"

21.a: The disciple Jesus loved wrote this book and bears witness that the events described in the book are true.
21.q: Who wrote this book and to what does he bear witness?
